summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated August 24, 2019, providing an update for a victim services website. It announces a change in location for a court hearing scheduled for August 27, 2019, in the case of United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The hearing was ordered to address a proposed nolle prosequi order following Epstein's death and will allow victims and their counsel to be heard.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died prior to August 19, 2019, leading the U.S. Attorney to propose a nolle prosequi (declination to prosecute) order.
A court hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, specifically to address this proposed order and to allow victims and their counsel to be heard.
The hearing location was changed and set to occur at 40 Foley Square in New York City before Judge Richard M. Berman.
The document is an official update from the U.S. Attorney's Office intended for a victim and witness services website, indicating ongoing procedural obligations to victims after Epstein's death.
The case docket number is 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating it was filed in 2019 in the Southern District of New York.
